comment.body: 1. To be part of a revolution, a net truly owned by the people. 2. Torrentfreak I guess or reddit. I always thought that  in our times of facebook and surveillance decentralised networks may  be the future and that someone should develop it. Then I found ZeroNet ;)
Often the reason reveals itself in the future. Sometimes you need to go into the valley to know how big a mountain can be. Same goes for sadness and joy. :)
You're a funny guy, are you?

@Vivisect: I been thinking the same lately...with text only, purposeful discussion becomes more important. If I look at Facebook and see all these selfies and self-adulation then ZeroNet looks refreshing :) Although I am not saying that images wouldn't be nice ;)

@Vivisect: Ahaha yes that reminds me of my last attempts at writing a physical letter, my handwriting skills have become so awful. I am used to re-write and correct my sentences and paper won't forgive mistakes.
how do you know a site exists? I've added the tags but how I can be sure my site is added?
@Alex: Thanks for your answer :) Can you add http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DaXkbpBN7d9h78T5mjB2gTV9Ui46Bjwcv/
What about Startpage @https://eu.startpage.com/ ? DDG uses US servers if I understand right...but for "freeware" DDG gives me better results than Google, that's right.
VM is a good idea - pick any light weight linux distro and run its connection through a proxy/vpn so that your server is on a different network and you can test properly.
@jro: Possibly your optional files are bigger/more that the normal files? I mean there is a limitation on the size of non-optional files.
Welcome to the club :) You have not been on ZeroNet for a while, great to have you back Alex
My sites are not in your index - can you add instructions on your page on how to get them indexed?

@Alex: Thanks I followed the instructions for [Prism-Break Mirror](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Br4MT7PgsRET2APJkbhqqoxwL1CqcCFxh). [ZeroLeakz](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DaXkbpBN7d9h78T5mjB2gTV9Ui46Bjwcv) I set up that way months ago and it used to show up, but no anymore - can you check what's wrong with it?
